Metadata: Using spatially explicit data to evaluate marine protected areas for abalone in southern California

To aid in the restoration of white, pink, and green abalone, productive marine protected areas (MPAs) need to be selected. In this study researchers used spatially explicit fishery data (1950-1995) to identify the most productive marine areas in southern California. They also compared the density, sizes number of juveniles, and estimates of potential egg production among two no-take MPAs and one fished area to assess the efficacy of MPAs.
